intro: Davilanthus veracruzanus, commonly known as the Mexican bellflower, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. It has lance-shaped leaves and produces clusters of showy blooms during the summer months. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, though it is considered rare in the wild.
